name: doziness
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the feeling of being tired and wanting to sleep: He closed his eyes, lulled into doziness by the rhythm of the tracks. One of the side effects of these travel sickness pills is doziness.
UK the fact of being slow to think or react, or not very intelligent: I'm not saying I'm thick, but I have a kind of doziness generally about me. The mistake was down to my own doziness, I'm afraid. See
dozy
More examplesFewer examplesIn early Roman times, the leaves were eaten at the end of a meal to induce mild doziness in the diner.Treatment allows apnea sufferers to sleep through the night, curing their doziness and slow reaction times.We can forgive a rare moment of doziness in a legend.You can only hope such doziness is a demographic blip.
